senses.de: Describes something that is typical or belongs to a certain person, place or thing.
senses.ex: The red spot is a characteristic feature of Jupiter.

Tips.title: Cultural Identification
Tips.description: Characteristic as an adjective can describe cultural or regional features that are unique.
Tips.example: Sushi is a characteristic dish of Japanese cuisine.

Tips.title: Describing People
Tips.description: Use 'characteristic' to highlight unique habits or qualities of a person.
Tips.example: Her laughter is characteristic; you know it's her from afar.

Tips.title: Not Always Positive
Tips.description: Being characteristic doesn't mean it's good—it simply emphasizes distinctiveness.
Tips.example: Unfortunately, heavy rain is characteristic of the city's weather.

senses.de: A feature or quality that belongs to a certain person, place or thing.
senses.ex: One of his characteristics is his punctuality.

Tips.title: Singular or Plural
Tips.description: As a noun, 'characteristic' can be singular for one feature, or plural for more.
Tips.example: Her characteristics include creativity and punctuality.

Tips.title: Identifying Groups
Tips.description: Characteristics can help identify and describe specific groups or categories.
Tips.example: The characteristics of a mammal include having fur and warm blood.

Tips.title: Personal Traits
Tips.description: In human context, characteristics often refer to personality and behavior.
Tips.example: She's known for her characteristic honesty.

senses.de: In mathematics, it is the integer part of a logarithm.
senses.ex: In the number 3.14159, the characteristic is 3.

Tips.title: Technical Use
Tips.description: The mathematical use is specialized and won't be used in everyday conversation.
Tips.example: He calculated the characteristic to solve the logarithmic equation.

Tips.title: Math Context Clue
Tips.description: In math, 'characteristic' will often be accompanied by numbers or math symbols.
Tips.example: Find the characteristic of log base 10 of the number 1000.

Tips.title: Rare Outside Math
Tips.description: The math definition is rarely encountered outside educational or scientific contexts.
Tips.example: During the maths class, we learned that the characteristic is not the decimal part.

Attribute.wordDefinition:
Attribute refers to a specific quality or feature that something or someone has.

It is often used to describe a particular aspect of a person or object. For example, a person's intelligence, creativity or sense of humour are considered attributes.

In essence, attribute refers to a specific feature, while characteristic refers to a general trait. Both of these words can describe people, animals, objects or places depending on what you are trying to communicate.

Distinctive.wordDefinition:
Characteristic refers to a feature or attribute that is common or typical of a certain thing. Distinctive refers to a feature or attribute that is unique and sets apart a certain thing from others.

For example, the characteristic of a bird is having feathers, while the distinctive feature of a peacock is its colorful plumage.

In other words, characteristic refers to something that is shared by a group or category, while distinctive refers to something that makes a particular thing stand out from the rest.

Feature.wordDefinition:
Both the words characteristic and feature refer to the qualities or attributes of something.

Characteristic is commonly used to describe the unique, defining qualities of a person, thing, or group. For example, the characteristic features of a cat might include its whiskers, sharp claws, and ability to retract its claws into its paws.

Feature is more commonly used to describe a specific aspect of something that is prominent or important.

For example, the features of a car could include its color, size, number of seats or horsepower.

Similarly, a software program might include a range of features such as ease of use, accessibility, or advanced functionality.

In summary, while both words refer to qualities or attributes, characteristic typically describes inherent and defining qualities that distinguish something, while feature describes a prominent or important aspect of something that might make it attractive or useful to others.

Identify.wordDefinition:
Identify means to recognize or name something or someone.

It describes the process of discovering who or what something is, such as identifying a bird species or a suspect in a crime.

Characteristic refers to the unique qualities that define someone or something, while identify refers to the process of recognizing, naming or associating someone or something with a specific group or context.

Mark.wordDefinition:
A mark is a distinguishing feature or sign that sets something or someone apart from others. For example, a mark of a good chef is attention to detail.

A characteristic describes something's inherent or typical attributes, while a mark describes something's distinguishing or exceptional attributes.

Peculiar.wordDefinition:
Peculiar refers to a quality or feature that is unusual or distinct to a person, thing, or situation.

For example, if we say that the way a person talks is peculiar, we mean that the way they speak is unusual or different from what is expected.

Characteristic is used when talking about something that is typical or expected, while peculiar is used when talking about something that is unusual or unexpected.

Trait.wordDefinition:
A trait refers to a specific aspect of a person's personality or behavior. For example, a trait of someone's personality may be their sense of humor or their tendency to be organized.

Essentially, characteristics are broader and more general, while traits are specific and individual. Both words can describe people, things, or groups, but in different contexts.

Typical.wordDefinition:
Typical means something that is usual or commonly observed. It is a general representation or expectation of something.

For example, wearing a hat in the winter is typical.

A characteristic defines an individual or object, while typical describes a general expectation or norm.

quotes.Text: The most obvious characteristic of science is its application: the fact that, as a consequence of science, one has a power to do things. And the effect this power has had need hardly be mentioned. The whole industrial revolution would almost have been impossible without the development of science.
quotes.Title: American Physicist
quotes.Name: Richard P. Feynman

quotes.Text: I consider that part of my job as a pro: to know who you're up against and how the attacking players play, what kind of characteristics they have, their qualities, how they move, their preferred foot.

quotes.Text: The main thing that's missing in energy is an incentive to create things that are zero-CO2-emitting and that have the right scale and reliability characteristics.

quotes.Text: As it is the characteristic of great wits to say much in few words, so small wits seem to have the gift of speaking much and saying nothing.

quotes.Text: When you play characters, you shouldn't just be putting on their characteristics - you should be finding it inside yourself.

quotes.Text: One of the very important characteristics of a student is to question. Let the students ask questions.

quotes.Text: The U.S. increasingly has taken on the characteristics of what we describe as 'failed states.

quotes.Text: We're all different, and we have to accept and tolerate each other's characteristics.

quotes.Text: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
